thread.title: Tracy Morgan tour dates: Comedian's return to stage includes 2 Upstate NY shows
thread.title_full: Tracy Morgan tour dates: Comedian's return to stage includes 2 Upstate NY shows

author: Geoff Herbert | gherbert@syracuse.com
title: Tracy Morgan tour dates: Comedian's return to stage includes 2 Upstate NY shows
text:
NBC video still 
Tracy Morgan is back, ladies and gentlemen. 
Following his triumphant comeback at the Emmy Awards and " Saturday Night Live ," the standup comedian is going back on tour for the first time since being seriously injured in a 2014 car crash. The nationwide "Tracy Morgan: Picking up the Pieces" tour will begin Feb. 5, 2016, at the Horseshoe Casino in Hammond, Indiana, he announced Tuesday. 
Morgan's return to the stage include two Upstate New York stops: Friday, Feb. 26 at the Seneca Niagara Casino & Hotel in Niagara Falls, and Tuesday, March 8 at the Turning Stone Resort Casino in Verona. Both performances are scheduled to begin at 8 p.m. 
Tickets for both shows go on sale Friday through Ticketmaster , at 10 a.m. for the Turning Stone show and at noon for the Niagara Falls show. Prices range from $45 to $85. 
The former "SNL" cast member and "30 Rock" star last performed in the Syracuse area to a sold-out at Destiny USA's Funny Bone Comedy Club. 
He was scheduled to perform at the Turning Stone last August, but he was injured in a June 2014 accident when a truck crashed into the van he was riding in on the New Jersey Turnpike. Comedian James "Jimmy Mack" McNair was killed in the crash and Morgan was in a coma for two weeks. 
When Morgan returned to "SNL" as a guest-host this past weekend, he reprised popular characters like Brian Fellow and joked about his lengthy recovery. 
"People are wondering, 'Can he speak? Does he have 100 percent mental capacity?'" he said in his opening monologue. 
"The truth is, I never did. I might even be a few points higher."
